Every plan starts with an idea.
Everyone can comment and make suggestions to contribute towards the draft stage.
%app-name% centers its drafting process around ideas.
An idea is a change that someone wants to see.
An idea is a change that someone wants to see. For example: improving access to public housing, or increasing the safety of our roads.
Share your idea to encourage debate.
Drafts are versions of the action plan as it is being written.
Drafts are crafted by the writers that have been nominated for an idea.
Everyone can comment and make suggestions.
Collaborative policy making for democratic organisations.
Gather community opinion, generate ideas, share, discuss, vote and collaborate with experts to draft new action plans.
which describes the change the organisation wants to achieve.

and each one is reviewed by the community.

Writers work with each other and the community to draft action plans.
No writers have been invited yet.
We are developing and designing %app-name% in the open. This allows the tool evolve as you use it, as you give feedback, and as the developers update and add content.

It is important to note that during this time data may be removed or destroyed as part of our process. Any of the views and data expressed here is to be used for example purposes only and does not accurately represent the real views of users.

How to get involved

This project is open source and we are inviting people to collaborate with us to build a better tool. For developers and you can find the code on github at https://github.com/ThoughtWorksInc/objective8. We will also be adding details for upcoming usability sessions shortly.

Have you got an idea?

We are really interested in user feedback and are currently inviting people to leave comments our github issues page.
Questions are how %app-name% gathers community ideas for use in turning an idea into an action plan
No answers have been given yet
Answers are a maximum length of 500 characters
You must sign in to add an answer
By answering this question, you are helping to create an action plan that better represents your beliefs and values.
The answer must be between 1 and 500 characters
%app-name% is a platform to enable collaborative policy making for democratic organisations.

Policy is used by governments and organisations to make consistent and fair decisions in order to achieve desired outcomes.

An idea is a change that could be achieved by introducing new policy. For example: improving access to public housing, or increasing the safety of our roads.

Writers work with each other and the community to create action plans. They use the crowdsourced questions, answers and comments to produce action plan drafts. These are further refined through cycles of feedback and redrafting.

You can get involved and have your say by creating and sharing ideas, offering your opinion through comments, asking and answering questions, suggesting policy writers, or even providing feedback on the action plan drafts themselves. The whole process is open and transparent.

ALPHA: this is a testing version of %app-name% data and content may change several times a day
This website uses cookies to ensure you get the best experience.
Find out more about how we use cookies
To make this site work properly, we sometimes place small data files called cookies on your device.

A cookie is a small text file that a website saves on your computer or mobile device when you visit the site. It enables the website to remember your actions and preferences (such as login, language, font size and other display preferences) over a period of time, so you don’t have to keep re-entering them whenever you come back to the site or browse from one page to another.

We use Google Analytics, a popular web analytics service provided by Google, Inc. Google Analytics uses cookies to help us to analyse how users use the site. It counts the number of visitors and tells us things about their behaviour overall – such as the typical length of stay on the site or the average number of pages a user views.

The information generated by the biscuit about your use of our website (including your IP address) will be transmitted to and stored by Google on servers in the United States. Google will use this information for the purpose of evaluating your use of our website, compiling reports on website activity and providing other services relating to website activity and internet usage.

Google may also transfer this information to third parties where required to do so by law, or where such third parties process the information on Google's behalf. Google undertakes not to associate your IP address with any other data held by Google.

You can control and/or delete cookies as you wish – for details, see aboutcookies.org. You can delete all cookies that are already on your computer and you can set most browsers to prevent them from being placed. If you do this, however, you may have to manually adjust some preferences every time you visit a site and some services and functionalities may not work.
